which is the partition Vista is on ?
you need to manually add a GRUB entry to /boot/grub/menu.lst that will access the Vista partition and make the boot from there

do a "sudo fdisk -l" and paste its contents on pastebin
pastebin is at http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
that'll help you get write access to your partition, but didn't you say you want to boot into it ?

there's a slight understanding problem here: stormx is trying to help with write access to the ntfs partition, i'm trying to help with booting into vista again. now WHAT do you want to be helped with ? so that we don't talk together, with the obvious result of your head exploding into tiny little pieces

that will launch nano as root
